alert.note: Alert for Fannin (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 12:43PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Gilmer, Murray, eastern Whitfield and northwestern Fannin Counties through 115 PM EST... At 1242 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Tennga to near Dawnville, and moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Dalton, Chatsworth, Eton, Crandall, Sumac, Ramhurst, Jones Mill, Higdon, Gregory, Cohutta Wilderness, Epworth, Conasauga Lake, Tennga, Beaverdale, Dawnville, Cisco, Fort Mountain State Park, Colwell and North Georgia Speedway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EST for north central and northwestern Georgia.
